alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 6:36PM EST until February 20 at 1:04AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding begins on Braceville Robinson Road. Portions of Barcley Messerly Road south of Eagle Creek Road will be impassable. Some homes will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM on Friday evening, the last reported stage was 12.9 feet. No new gage data has been received since then, but law enforcement continues to report ongoing flooding. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EST Saturday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tonight and reach 7.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 02/27/1929. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 115 AM EST.
